channel.title: Behavioral science research
channel.description:
A documentary series on behavioral science and its role in understanding human health.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Research and government's role
item.description: This program explores research and the government's role in behavioral science studies. Guests are: Max F. Millikan, Ph.D.; Raymond A. Bauer, Ph.D.; Ralph W. Tyler, Ph.D; Philip Q. Roche, M.D.; and Alex Bavelas, Ph.D.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Man and machines, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, talks about the relationship between man and machines. Guest are: Harry Helson, Ph.D.; Jack Dunlap, Stamford, Conn.; and Edward R. Jones, Ph.D., McDonnell Aircraft Corp., St. Louis.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Man in a group
item.description: This program focuses on the research of human groups. Guests are: George C. Homans, Ph.D; and Alex Bavelas, Ph.D.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Religion and science
item.description: This program focuses on research in religion and science. Guests are: C. Leslie Glenn, B.D., University of Michigan; Rev. George C. Anderson, Academy of Religion and Mental Health, New York City; and Earl Loomis, M.D., Union Theological Seminary, New York City.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Behavioral science and law, part five
item.description: This program, the fifth of five parts, explores research on law and behavior. Guests are: The Honorable David L. Bazelon; Philip Q. Roche, M.D.; and Harry Kalven, M.D.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Man and machines, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, talks about the relationship between man and machines. Guest are: Harry Helson, Ph.D.; Jack Dunlap, Stamford, Conn.; and Edward R. Jones, Ph.D., McDonnell Aircraft Corp., St. Louis.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Future developments, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, looks at future developments in behavioral science. Guests are: James G. Miller, M.D., Ph.D., University of Michigan; Anatol Rapoport, Ph.D., University of Michigan; Ralph Gerard, M.D., Ph.D., University of Michigan; and Merrill Flood, Ph.D., University of Michigan.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Ethics of human manipulation
item.description: This program explores the ethics of human manipulation. Guests are: Ralph W. Tyler, Ph.D.; Philip Q. Roche, M.D.; Jack W. Dunlap, Ph.D; R. Duncan Luce, Ph.D.; and Raymond A Bauer, Ph.D.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Behavioral science and law, part three
item.description: This program, the third of five parts, explores how the doctor and the lawyer view the law. Guests are: Bernard Diamond, M.D., psychiatrist, San Francisco; and Anne Diamond, attorney, San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Religion and mental health
item.description: This program focuses on research in religion and mental health. Guests are: C. Leslie Glenn, B.D., University of Michigan; Rev. George C. Anderson, Academy of Religion and Mental Health, New York City; and Earl Loomis, M.D., Union Theological Seminary, New York City.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Creativity
item.description: This program focuses on research into creativity. Guest is Morris I. Stein, Ph.D., University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Cultural difference and change
item.description: This program focuses on the study of cultural difference and change. Guests are: Robert Anderson, Ph.D; John Whiting, Ph.D, Harvard University; and Robert Garneiro, Ph.D., American Museum of Natural History, New York City.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Communications media's role in science
item.description: This program focuses on the media's role in science. Guests are: Russell L. Ackoff, Ph.D.; Alex Bavelas, ph.D; Bernard Diamond, M.D.; Anne Diamond, attorney; Harry Kalven, Jr., M.D.; Ralph W. Tyler, Ph.D.; and Raymond A. Bauer, Ph.D
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: How behavior influences the economy
item.description: This program focuses on the ways in which human behavior can influence the economy. Guests are: Max Milliken, Ph.D.; Jacob Marschak, Ph.D., Yale University; Kenneth J. Arrow, Ph.D., Stanford University.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Marriage, divorce and family stability
item.description: This program discusses behavioral science and how it can help people's marriages. Guests include: Martin Grotjahn, MD, UCLA; and Don D. Jackson, MD, Palo Alto Medical Clinic.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Performance and stress
item.description: This program focuses on research into human performance and stress. Guests are: Louis Jolyon West, M.D., University of Oklahoma; and Robert H. Felix, M.D.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Future developments, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, looks at future developments in behavioral science. Guests are: Rensis Likert, Ph.D., University of Michigan; Angus Campbell, Ph.D., University of Michigan; and Alvin F. Zander, M.P.H., Ph.D., University of Michigan.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Behavioral science and law, part two
item.description: This program, the second of five parts, discusses a new approach to the law. Guests are: The Honorable David L. Bazelon; Philip Q. Roche, M.D.; and Harry Kalven, Jr., M.D., University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Behavioral science and law, part one
item.description: This program, the first of five parts, discusses some historic aspects of the law and mental health. Guest is The Hon. David L. Bazelon, Circuit Judge, U.S. Court of Appeals, Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Juvenile delinquency, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on juvenile delinquency and how behavioral science can help assess and improve it. Guest are: Benjamin Harris Balser, MD; Leon Eisenberg, MD, Johns Hopkins Hospital; and Helen Witmer, Ph.D., Office of Health, Education and Welfare.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Juvenile delinquency, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on juvenile delinquency and how behavioral science can help assess and improve it. Guest are: Benjamin Harris Balser, MD; Leon Eisenberg, MD, Johns Hopkins Hospital; and Helen Witmer, Ph.D., Office of Health, Education and Welfare.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: The decision process
item.description: This program focuses on research of the human decision making process. Guest are: R. Duncan Luce, Ph.D., Univ of Pennsylvania; Patrick Suppes, Ph.D, Stanford University; and Donald Davidson, Ph.D, Stanford University.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Decision making in economics
item.description: This program continues the discussion about how decision making has an effect on the economy. Guests are: Jacob Marschak, Ph.D., Yale University; and Kenneth J. Arrow, Ph.D., Stanford University.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Computers as simulators
item.description: This program focuses on the idea of computers as simulators. Guest is Russell L. Ackoff, Ph.D., Case Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Behavioral science and law, part four
item.description: This program, the fourth of five parts, explores how the doctor and the lawyer view the law. Guests are: Bernard Diamond, M.D., psychiatrist, San Francisco; and Anne Diamond, attorney, San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: What is behavioral science?
item.description: This program seeks a definition for behavioral science. Guests include: Ralph Tyler, Ph.D., Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences; Raymond A. Bauer, Ph.D, Harvard; and Dr. Max Millikan, Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Sociology
